text: Sarah Brady (née Kemp; February 6, 1942 – April 3, 2015) was an American activist. She was the widow of White House Press Secretary James Brady. She was a prominent campaigner for gun control. Brady was born in Baltimore, Maryland. Brady died at her home in Alexandria, Virginia, due to complications from pneumonia, aged 73. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American activists Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Infectious disease deaths in Virginia Category:People from Baltimore
title: Sarah Brady
